characters: TENTACLES REACHING INTO THE EARTHLY PLANE.
IN THE STORM CLOUDS, LIGHTNING ILLUMINATES GARGANTUAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a photographic DARKROOM: old optical enlargers, porcel trays, timers, and stills hanging out to dry. GEORGE MATLIN, a slightly obese, nearsighted man in his  seventies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he real? Oh yeah -- Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Super: CPL. GEORGE MATLIN, combat photographer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't talked about it for years,  you know? (looks at the camera) Everyone called me crazy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matlin smiles as he paws through a box of old negatives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I have the negative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone turns on the darkroom's red safety light for an e dramatic effect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get ready, 3-2-1... Roll tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It all started back in Вґ44. I was a  Corps photographer aboard an allied  submarine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOUNG MATLIN's hands again paw through a bunch of negativ again under a red light. Now, at 21, he's wedged in a  submarine corridor, a crowded maze of pipes and gauges. 35mm still cameras dangle from his neck. He shrinks back a squad of MARINES hustles past him, loading weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...off the coast of Scotland.  Classified mission. I was 21...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SGT. WHITMAN, 44, tough as nails, pushes through, his uni soaked in sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had an English civilian on board.  Not much older than me but already  an advisor to President Roosevelt.  "Paranormal" advisor, I kid you not --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whitman continues down the passageway until he reaches a  small...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Within, an incongruously proper young Englishman "reading an ancient set of Tarot cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name was Trevor. Profesor Trevor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Broom! Topside, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TREVOR "BROOM" BRUTTENHOLM is a gaunt, olive-skinned man his late twenties. In his hands, a tarot deck. He turns t cards face up: THE FOOL, THE MOON...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sooner we're done, the better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broom grabs a worn-down wooden box full of books and amul It has a leather strap that allows him to carry it, much  like a carpenter's tool box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is an important mission, Sgt.  Whitman. I hope you realize that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh -- you don't wanna know what I  think. Topside, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves away. Broom takes a small box and a few amulets. Before exiting, he pauses and tensely turns the last TARO CARD: THE DEVIL.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. SCOTLAND
dialogues.text: Super: OCTOBER 9, 1944, SCOTLAND. It's raining like hell now. Soldiers move through a short tunnel carved into the mountain. Whitman signals his men to spread out, then comes alongsi Broom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sgt. Whitman!! Sgt. Whitman!! May I  have a word??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatient) What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In private, if you don't mind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter the remains of a small chapel. Broom produces small box. It's full of rosaries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your men -- They'll need these --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whitman scowls and huffs. A life-sized wooden Christ  contemplates the scene from above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are a Catholic??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amongst other things, yes -- but  that's hardly the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whitman locks and loads an automatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. You'll need one of these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I abhor violence. (Whitman moves away) Sergeant Whitman, I hope you don't  think me mad --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three days too late for that one,  "professor."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves away. Broom looks up to the wooden Christ: It ha no eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATLIN hauls his tripod and gear and joins the troops on move. Broom catches up with Whitman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wasting our time: There's  nothing on this island but sheep and  rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruins. Not rocks. The remains of  Trondham Abbey. Built on an  intersection of Ley Lines, the  boundaries between our world and the  other --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupts him) What a load of crap. Hell, a week  ago I hadn't even heard the word  parabnormal --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Paranormal" (Whitman moves on) But -- you read the transmission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half transmission. Nonsense -- German  ghost stories!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have seen ghosts, Whitman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'll bet you have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reaching a slope, Matlin sets down his camera. Turning, h sees lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drenched, Broom and Whitman look down upon an impressive  ROMANESQUE RUIN. Under worklights, dozens of NAZI SOLDIER swarm among thick stone walls and archways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They must be here for the sheep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dozen German soldiers swiftly assemble a large steel  MACHINE. The work is monitored by a spindly Nazi in BLACK LEATHER, his face covered by an odd gas mask: KROENEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The freak in the gas mask --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karl Ruprecht Kroenen, one of the  Reich's top Scientists. Head of the  Thule Occult Society.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lowers a pair of binoculars and passes them to Whitman

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he's here, this is worse than I  thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the radio man) Air and sea backup. What's closest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RADIOMAN cranks a transmitter to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Londonderry, sir. Forty minutes away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have forty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kroenen throws a switch: On the machine, dozens of gears  respond! Steam pistons thrust copper rails upright, lifting two mi metal rings, not unlike a gyroscope. Kroenen grunts and  signals for more floodlights to be turned on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights flood an ancient sacristy lined with eroded st saints. GRIGORY, tall and gaunt, stands naked, arms fully extended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No matter what happens to me, you  must carry on with the work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ILSA, a severe, ageless Aryan beauty, reverentially drape an embroidered robe over his bony shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will not leave you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you will... Leave me. Deny me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands her a small LEATHER-BOUND BOOK. It contains hand drawn notes and illustrations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This will guide you back to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls her close, the clouds of their breath mingling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I grant you everlasting life, youth  and the power to serve me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dips his fingers in a wooden bowl full of blood, then  wipes her tears away with a crimson thumb, both a consola and a ritual. VON KRUPT, an acrid German General, wearing dark SCARLET  glasses and LEATHER GLOVES, appears. Looks at his pocket  watch. On the gold lid: a SWASTIKA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grigory walks towards the machine, its colossal steel and copper clockworks gleaming in the floodlights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five years of research and  construction, Grigory. Five years!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He strides alongside Grigory and Ilsa, who holds an umbre to shield her master from the pouring rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The furhrer doesn't look kindly on  failure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There will be no failure, General. I  promised Herr Hitler a miracle. I'll  deliver one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kroenen mutters excitedly as he opens a polished oak box  containing a massive gold and copper MECHA-GLOVE. Grigory extends his hand so that KROENEN may fit him with the contraption, which is attached to cables and hoses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Americans fan out, unseen. Broom and Whitman dive into a ditch barely in time to avo a German foot patrol. Other GI's take up positions below a machine gun nest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grigory walks to the top of the altar, cables trailing be him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight, We will open a portal and  awaken the OGDRU JAHAD: The seven  Gods of chaos. (beat) Our enemies will be destroyed. In an  instant, all impurity in this world  will be razed and from the ashes a  new eden will arise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks down at the machine and whispers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ragnarok, Anung Ia Anung.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flexes his fingers and in response -- -- the two metal rings swing around the machine's central axis. TCHINK!!! WHIRRR!!! STEAM escapes from the ducts an pipes. An invisible blast of energy forces the falling ra to swerve momentarily away from Grigory's body. Ilsa signals TWO NAZI SCIENTISTS standing at a control pa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More Power!! Don't let the level  drop!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of them inserts a 20 inch SOLID GOLD CYLINDER into th machine. Two openings remain vacant next to it. A blade of light opens in the air! Burning symbols slash the air, like living serpents of fi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The edges of the cosmic slit sizzle with color; an ALIEN  GALAXY sparkles on the other side. Suddenly, a work light tears loose and flies in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The six-foot work light tumbles by the massive OGDRU JAHA seven egg-like monoliths of unholy origin. Within their translucent walls, horrible creatures lie  slumbering. As the light sweeps by, one of the giants ope a filmy eye, and then another, and another, and another.. Fleshy tentacles move lazily within their crystalline pri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grigory screams as his body rises. Veins swell in his nec his face distorted by ecstasy and pain. CLICK. Someone shoots a photograph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Matlin, snapping for all he's worth. Whitman pulls h down and pulls out a large bayonet blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me, you moron: you do that  again, I'll carve you a new --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late. One of the NAZI SCIENTIST has heard them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nazi SCIENTIST approaches. Pauses next to the box wit the GOLD CYLINDERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fierce whisper, to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me!!! The portal is open!!!  We have to stop them!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grigory dangles like a marionette in a new surge of energ Even the skeptical Von Krupt is in thrall. The NAZI SCIENTIST reaches for a second GOLD CYLINDER. Bu something else lands next to him: A GRENADE!!! The explosion blows him to pieces. In a few seconds, the  squad of Allies storms the area. A hail of bullets cuts down a dozen Nazis. The Allies ove the machine gun nest as grenades explode everywhere. VON KRUPT shoots wildly, hitting Broom in the leg. But  Whitman's bullets rip into the old Nazi's chest. Leaving a trail of blood, Broom crawls to a dead G.I. and grabs a grenade from his belt. TCHKKK!!! Kroenen extends two gleaming blades from twin s bands on his wrists and takes on an entire group of soldi mowing through them with swords spinning like deadly roto The steel chops clean through their weapons. Broom pulls the pin and throws the grenade at the generat CLICK-CLACK!! It wedges itself between two moving tie rod Kroenen squeals and -- retracting his blades -- lunges af it. The gyrating rails slice through his leather jacket. his fingers reach the grenade, it EXPLODES!!! Kroenen flies through the air, hitting a stone wall, wher two long pieces of shrapnel pin him like an insect. Another rail plunges -- FFFFT!!, like a javelin -- into t earth right next to MATLIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grigory!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grigory's face is distorted, pulled like ectoplasmic taff his body contorting and breaking. The cosmic portal sudde implodes! Nothing is left but a few burnt rails and the m glove, empty and smoking. As the Allies approach, the fighting rages on. Grigory and Ilsa are gone. And for now, so is Kroenen.  Embedded in the wall where he was pinned, two bloody rail nothing more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allied SOLDIERS penetrate the ruins. Matlin helps Broom u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's almost over!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up a sample of white, viscous goo from the outer rings of the smoking machine. Whitman approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cordon off the area. Something came  through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From where                        !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broom glances at a 13th century FRESCO depicting heaven a hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still raining. A group of soldiers spreads out, using  flashlights to scour through the rubble. Every one of the has a rosary hanging from the bayonet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broom hastily bandages his bleeding leg. Matlin and Whitm roam over the debris. Rain POURS through the broken roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you believe in hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a place -- a dark place  where evil slumbers and awaits to  return. From there it infects our  dreams. Our thoughts. Grigory gave  us a glance tonight --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grigory -- That's Russian, right? (Broom nods) Thought they were on our side...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grigory Yefimovich Rasputin --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon -- Rasputin??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spiritual advisor to the Romanovs. (beat) In 1916, at a dinner in his honor,  he was poisoned, shot, stabbed,  clubbed, drowned and castrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That makes him more than a hundred --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rustling sound reaches their ears. Matlin readies a han as Broom scans the walls with his flashlight. Something m accompanied by a loud scrape. Matlin cocks his pistol and nervously approaches a crumbl statue. SCREEEECH!!!! A RED THING jumps into the air!!  Instinctively, Matlin shoots at it. The RED THING leaps from arch to arch, followed by a trai of bullet hits. Whitman and other soldiers join them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Broom) What the hell was that? An ape?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It was red. Bright red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you two talking about??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A red ape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's-not-an-ape --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hear the labored breathing of a living creature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's got a big stone -- in its hand --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that is its hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hissing, the thing cowers between a gargoyle and a stone  saint. WHITMAN points his gun at the scarlet shape above. Broom  stops him from firing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In deep shadow, the RED THING observes with bright, golde eyes veined with streaks of burnt sienna. Broom slowly fishes a BABY RUTH candy bar from his pocket Peeling back the wrapper, he slowly waves the candy. The THING shrinks back. Broom bites into the candy and chews, noisily smacking hi lips. Offers the candy again. This time, out of the dark  comes a small FACE, not very different from the stone dem around it. The creature extends its right arm: it's solid stone with tiny runes engraved around the thick, cylindrical wrist.  Four articulated stone fingers wiggle, reaching for the  chocolate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus! would'ya look at the size of  that whammer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whitman moves closer. On the wall behind him, a shadow sh the RED THING climbing into Broom's arms. Broom tenderly covers it with a blanket. The stubby finge snatch the candy. Broom smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a boy. Just a baby boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldiers cluster around, curious to see it. Matlin  prepares his camera and directs them into a group shot. B smiles like a proud new father and embraces the creature, patting him gently. CLICK!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best photo of my career --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and no one has ever seen it. They  keep saying he's not real, but I  want to set the record straight before  I go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matlin finally pulls an old 8x10 from a battered portfoli He smiles, full of memories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. The real picture, not the  retouched one in LIFE magazine. (hands over the  photograph) This is him. The very same night we  found him. The night Broom gave him  that name. (beat) Can I say it on TV? He called him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles at the creature) HELLBOY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the blanket, Hellboy blinks his bright golden eyes and chews candy, his devilish red tail twitching happily.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Montage: Tabloid covers and news clippings screaming HELL SIGHTING IN RENO!! GOVERNMENT DENIAL!!! etc. TV Newscasters read lurid copy. SPRINGER excerpts (fist f included) feature the show's theme: I WAS HELLBOY'S BRIDE Some blurry, grainy footage depicts Hellboy crossing an a Much like Bigfoot in the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that. That's a costume. These  people amaze me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MANNING is a balding, official-looking guy in a suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With their conveniently blurry footage  of their beloved "Hellboy." And they  claim that he works for the FBI-?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manning on a TV SHOW a la Regis Philbin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the head of your division, you --  You have seen dozens of pictures  like this!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly -- so, why is it that they're  all out of focus? C'mon!! God knows,  people manage to get good pictures  at a wedding!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shows a blurry picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the alleged best man -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The audience applauds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the thick of a snowstorm, THREE FIGURES climb the icy  steps of a massive rock formation. Super: BIRGAU PASS, MOLDAVIA, PRESENT DAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The THREE FIGURES move through a narrow passage until the reach a DEAD END. FIGURE 1 stops at a symbol carved in the rocky ground and consults Grigory's LEATHER-BOUND BOOK. The symbol matches illustration in the book. Before them, a thick wall of ice. Using a heavy steel ham FIGURE 1 breaks through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will guide you no further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figure 2 produces two small GOLD INGOTS. Hands one to the guide. Keeps the other one. The Guide examines his pay greedily: engraved in it: a  SWASTIKA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ice curtain collapses, revealing a rough-walled corri FIGURE 1 spots a glowing firefly. They follow it into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cathedral-like vault that could easily hold a stadium.  From an opening somewhere above, eerie blue light streams down on a magnificent labyrinth. A few more fireflies speckle the air, winking on and off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The THREE FIGURES move past cyclopean statues guarding th inhuman architecture. The humans are dwarfed by the monum scale of the walkways and ramparts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the center of the labyrinth the stone floor is covered grooves radiating from a shallow stone basin. FIGURE 3 uncovers his face: he's a PEASANT GUIDE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Romanian) We shouldn't be here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIGURE 1 exchanges a meaningful look with FIGURE 2. FIGUR throws two solid gold pieces at the feet of the Sherpa. O them, an embossed SWASTIKA. After a greedy moment of thou the Peasant kneels to pick up the gold. TCHKK!!! A long, shiny blade pierces the Peasant's chest  from behind. He blinks twice and slumps forward. FIGURE 2 steps out from behind him, a long, bloody blade his hand. The figures uncover their faces. ILSA has not aged and  KROENEN, still wears the same tight gas mask. He cleans h blade in the snow and takes back the gold. Ilsa watches the Sherpa's blood as it runs in a steaming  rivulet, tracing a glyph in the grooves and filling the b A FIGURE RISES FROM THE BLOOD. A naked human shape, haloe by fireflies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your eyes. What did they do to your  eyes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mechanized rollers transport X-Ray films over a backlit  screen. A group of 4 DOCTORS studies the pictures and  exchanges somber looks. Rain spatters the windows. Doctor 1 glances at the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you told him yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor 2 looks through a glass partition at an aged but  dignified BROOM, 72, who slowly buttons his shirt. Hangin from his wrist, his rosary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malignant sarcoma. In the lungs...  the spine, liver...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Approximately... how long??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe -- six weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broom impassively takes in the information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can arrange for hospitalization,  pain management. Make the time more  bearable --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broom pensively shuffles his tarot cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) I'd rather... stay home, you know.  I'll be making arrangements -- (beat) For my son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can always get a second opinion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broom looks down: first card off the deck: DEATH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That won't be necessary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaves stir on the pavement. All the stores are decorated for Halloween. Two kids dressed as SKELETONS run in front Broom, carrying a JACK-O-LANTERN. Leaning on a cane, Broom exits the building and walks tow a waiting black Mercedes. The DRIVER (Agent Lime) opens t door. Broom pauses to buy a dozen BABY RUTH candy bars from a s vendor. In an ELECTRONICS STORE, a wall of TV's. The image of a R BLURRY SHAPE (HELLBOY) fills the screens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seeing this) Son...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Manning, what about the "Bureau  for Paranormal Research and Defense?"  The FBI has been known to conceal --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That word -- conceal --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: from the American public --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil -- Phil -- hold your little  green horses. Let me tell you and  the American public one thing --  this "Bureau for -- what was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paranormal Research and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Defense, right, well -- I'm here  to clear up this once and for all. (he looks at the camera) There-is-no-such-thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broom smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a wooded, new jersey hill, a low-slung, high-tech comp rests at the edge of a bluff, its foundation fused with t rock below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dolled-up MOD-STYLE moped stops at the massive gate.  Strapped to the luggage rack are two cheap suitcases. The driver, a very wet YOUNG MAN named MYERS, touches an old  fashioned buzzer under a sign reading "WASTE MANAGEMENT" A crackling INTERCOM VOICE answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shivering) John Myers, F.B.I. Transfer from  Quantico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, then -- WHIRRR!!! An EYEPIECE and an LCD screen  scanner pop out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at the birdie, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myers looks into the eyepiece. On the screen, Myers' corn is scanned. TWO VIOLET FLASHES. His ID and badge numbers  appear. CLACK! The gate opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moped putt-putts towards the building in the distance

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seated at a dramatic circular desk is a solitary guard. M approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, I'm --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Late. Five minutes late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Section fifty-one. Step back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two steps back, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confused, Myers picks up his suitcases and complies. He  realizes he's DEAD CENTER on a giant B.P.R.D. Logo: A HAN HOLDING A SWORD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch your hands and elbows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Immediately, the floor under Myers' feet starts down. He' on a small elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The panel overhead slides shut. A row of safety lights co on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in a vast underground area with other elevators movi up and down in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator stops in a narrow, dark space. Neon lights  flicker on, illuminating a circular chamber. PAINTED on t floor is a huge number: 51. Right in front of Myers: a magnificent oak door. Myers knocks on it. No answer. Myers enters. INT. BROOMВґS OFFICE (FULL AQUARIUM)- DUSK Myers looks around, fascinated: books. An office made of  them. The soft glow of green-shaded reading lamps bathes  everything in an intimate, warm light. One entire wall is a thick pane of glass, the wall of a h tank of water. A VOICE crackles through an intercom next the tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn the pages, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myers jumps, then moves closer to the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over here... if you don't mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the tank, ABE SAPIEN, a FISH-MAN glides in and out vie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myers looks at four BOOK STANDS facing the glass. Each  supports an open volume. He leans close to the glass, pee intently. Abe reappears. He is slender, dolphin gray, with dark pat streaking his soft skin. Bright blue eyes shine with  intelligence. Behind a thin wound-like mouth, gills are  bubbling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points at the books) These -- ? You're reading these -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abe nods. Through a side door, Broom enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four books at once. Every day -- as  long as I'm here to turn the pages. (smiles) My name's Broom. Professor Trevor  Broom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myers extends his hand in greeting --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I'm --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM! Abe presses his webbed hand against the glass, close his eyes -- all three lids. Abe's voice surges from the speaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent John T. Myers, Kansas City,  76. "T" stands for Thaddeus, mother's  older brother. Scar on your chin  happened when you were ten, you still  wonder if it's ever going to fade  away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- He. Not "it."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abraham Sapien. Discovered alive in  a secret chamber at St. Trinian's  Foundling Hospital, Washington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Points at a small piece of antique paper, framed on the w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They took his name from this little  inscription that was stuck on his  tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reads) Icthyo Sapiens, April 14, 1865.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The day Abraham Lincoln died. Hence  "Abe" Sapien.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broom uncovers a tray by the tank: Four greenish eggs. My gags and reels back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rotten eggs, a delicacy. Abe loves  them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abe smiles and takes a subaquatic bow, gracefully nabbing the eggs as they float through the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does he know so much about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abe possesses a unique frontal lobe. (beat) "Unique." That's a word you'll hear  quite a bit around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where am I -- exactly, Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you entered the lobby there was  an inscription --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the desk, yes. In Latin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impressive. Do you remember what it  said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs) "In absentia luci, tenebrae  vinciunt..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "In the absence of light, darkness  prevails." For there are things that  go bump in the night, Agent Myers. (smiles) We are the ones who bump back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myers and Broom walk down a corridor. The walls are lined with glass cases containing occult artifacts. Myers eyes MUMMIFIED HAND, a CLAY GOLEM, a sumptuous PAGAN ALTAR...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1937: Hitler joins "The Thule Society" --  a group of German aristocrats obsessed  with the occult.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to an ANCIENT, BROKEN LANCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1938: he acquires the Spear of  Longinus, which pierced the body of  Christ. He who holds it becomes  invincible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gestures at an ancient LANCE. Next to it: a silver and gold reliquary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hitler's power increases tenfold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go through a series of pneumatic doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In 1943, President Roosevelt decides  to fight back. THE BUREAU FOR  PARANORMAL RESEARCH AND DEFENSE is  born.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Workmen are replacing two of the doors. Big dents from an oversized fist have deformed the 2-inch thick metal plate Myers stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1958, the occult war finally ends  when Adolf Hitler dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1945, you mean. Hitler died in '45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enigmatic smile) Did he, now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach a FINAL DOOR. Stainless steel, like a BANK VAU Waiting there is AGENT CLAY, a burly guy in a suit, with cartful of BEEF AND MASHED POTATOES. A dinner pile at lea 4 feet high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Myers, this is Agent Clay.  Follow his lead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broom hands Myers two BABY RUTH bars and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broom signals "no."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hand-picked you from a roster of  over seventy academy graduates. Make  me proud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door closes behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not speaking. Professor Broom  had him grounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grounded? Who's grounded?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. You saw the fish man, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myers nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, come on in and meet the rest  of the family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay uses an odd-shaped ELECTRONIC KEY to unlock the door Three solenoid locks turn. Two steel vertical PISTONS ope up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay pushes the cart into a solid concrete bunker, window austere except for a few SAMURAI suits of ARMOR and WEAPO Dozens of CATS wander around; others are curled up on the furniture. There are Zippo's everywhere, from every era. On a sofa (made from the bed of a pickup truck) is a heap blankets and comic books. All in all, a MEGA BACHELOR PAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto voce) He gets fed six times a day. He's  got a thing for cats. You'll be his  nanny, his keeper, his best friend.  He never goes out unsupervised --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay points at a torn comic book: HELLBOY, THE UNCANNY. M picks it up, looks at the cover: it shows Hellboy -- in a U.S. Uniform, fighting a monstrous ape. Myers watches, amazed, as a bright red TAIL waves in and of a pool of light about ten feet away. One of the cats  playfully paws at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto voce) You're kidding --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those comics -- They never got the  eyes right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The voice is a deep baritone, chesty and powerful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Clay, sotto voce) Oh, Jesus!! Hellboy -- ?? Is real --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto voce) Yup. Sixty years old by our count.   But he doesn't age like we do --  think dog years: He's barely out of  his teens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myers gasps, seeing a monumental figure in the shadows,  exercising with a 300 lb. Stainless steel DUMBBELL. Crims biceps like cooked hams. Chomping an unlit CIGAR stub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with the hair, Clay?? Finally  got those implants??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Clay blushes as he hides his scalp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll fill in. Where do you want  your dinner, Red? By the couch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a nearby pile of junked TV sets, a loop of Fleischer  cartoons and home movies cycles endlessly. One subject ap over and over: an ATTRACTIVE YOUNG WOMAN with a pale face and raven-black hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the squirt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Myers is your new liaison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got tired of me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. I'll be around, Red, just back  in the field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG!!! Hellboy lets the dumbbell drop. Instinctively, My jumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manning says I'm too soft on you -- (sotto voce, nudging  Myers) The candy. Give him the candy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myers remembers he's holding the Baby Ruths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Uh. Hello. I -- I have these.  For you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing) Father's back? (Clay nods) Still angry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you did break out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to see her. (grunts) It's nobody's business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is. You got yourself on TV again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Myers", huh? You have a first name??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto to Myers) Try not to stare. He hates when people  stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh -- John. (sotto) Staring at what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His horns. He files 'em. To "fit  in."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His what                        !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy finally enters the light. He's awe-inspiring, wit chiseled features, patterned red skin and deep-set golden eyes. Involuntarily, Myers recoils. In spite of himself, Myers is staring at the horn stumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatcha looking at, John??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh-n-no -- I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ALARM sounds, and a red light blinks on the wall. Myer looks around, bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Clay) Hey, hey, hey. They're playing our  song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on the move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Myers) C'mon, Champ! Happy Halloween!!!  You're taking me for a walk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An imposing four-story structure, all pillars and pedimen A HALLOWEEN BANNER advertises: MAGICK: THE ANCIENT POWER. Super: THE MACHEN LIBRARY, MANHATTAN  Chaos near the entrance: policemen, TV reporters, MOUNTED POLICE. Loud protests from the reporters as a line of black sedan cars are waved through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NYPD has yet to issue a statement.  We've got SWAT vans, paramedics, you  name it...  and now here's -- a  garbage truck -- (double take) -- a garbage truck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trailing behind the cars, a GARBAGE TRUCK. On its side a  mirrored sign reads: SQUEAKY CLEAN INC. Waste Management  Services.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN AGENT is driving the truck, with MYERS at his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd parts like the Red Sea for the garbage truck. D of faces are reflected in the truck's mirrored logo. A MO POLICEMAN rides past the mirrored sides of the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MOUNTED POLICEMAN is visible as he rides by. The mirr are see-through. The back of the truck is a fully-equippe crime lab, crammed with hi-tech gear and low-tech talisma ABE fits a respirator over his face. It looks like a  mechanized Elizabethan collar. Valves bubble and hiss as inhales liquid through his mouth and out his gills.  Hellboy looks out onto the CROWD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at them ugly suckers, Blue. One  sheet of glass between them and us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Story of my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I break it, they see us, Happy  Halloween. No more hiding. (nostalgic) Outside. I could be outside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, outside... with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy straps on a huge utility belt heavy with amulets, rosaries, horseshoes. From an ashtray he grabs a handful stogie stubs. Lights one, puts the rest in a pouch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get psychic with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing psychic about it. You're  easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy unlocks a STEEL BOX (STENCILED ON ITS LID: "THE G SAMARITAN") and extracts the meanest-looking, custom-buil double-barrel, blue-finished, handgun ever made. A verita cannon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How am I ever gonna get a girl?? I  drive around in a garbage truck

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz left us, Red. Take the hint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hefting the gun) We don't take hints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GARBAGE TRUCK pulls into an interior courtyard and st FBI/BPRD teams spread through the area, expelling uniform cops and securing the doors. THREE AGENTS -- QUARRY, STONE and MOSS -- close a gate,  sealing off the area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All areas secured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a nearby roof, Agent Lime signals all clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into a handheld radio) Seal the doors. Red and Blue are  coming in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck stops, Clay pulls a lever. Myers watches as the dumpster loader hinges down like a drawbridge, revealing  HELLBOY and ABE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, boys, let's synch up our  locators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abe, Clay and Hellboy activate lights on their belts. The BEEP and blink. Hellboy starts walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As BPRD agents clear the area, Clay, Myers, Abe and Hellb march through the main lobby. On view, various display ca Two BANNERS flank the marble staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading a report) At nineteen hundred hours an alarm  tripped. B&E. Robbery. Six guards  dead --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on -- hold on -- I thought we  checked this place. Fakes, and  reproductions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently not everything was fake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broom stands at the base of the marble staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised to see him) Father...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myers observes as the red Goliath sheepishly averts his g from that of the fragile old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They approach an oversize set of brass doors. Abe removes a leather glove from his hand. FWAP!! he spre his webbed fingers on the door. He closes his three eyeli and concentrates. Two agents arrive with a rolling munitions case. Myers  observes as Hellboy opens it and looks over a potpourri o bullets of all colors and shapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 16th century statue was destroyed.  Saint Dionysius the Aeropagite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who wards off demons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smuggled into this country by an  overzealous curator. The statue,  however, was hollow --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reliquary --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A prison. The Vatican deemed its  contents dangerous enough to include  it on the List of Avignon. Of which  we hold a copy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy selects a clip full of bullets and a speed loader

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would'ya look at this babies? Made  'em myself. Holy water, silver  shavings, white oak: the works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling his hand  away) Behind this door. A dark entity --  Evil, ancient and hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abe quickly starts scanning a few leather-bound volumes o ancient magic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, well. Lemme go in and say "hi".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As HELLBOY opens the big doors, a flickering amber glow  illuminates him. He steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLUE emergency lamps are on. The exhibits are destroyed;  piles of debris are burning. Hellboy walks past a fallen  display case. He moves around cautiously. A couple of large carvings an statues startle him. On the floor: boots, half chewed. Bitten belts and shreds uniforms and hats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers into radio) Blue: It stinks in here -- Finely  aged roadkill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sickening sound of snapping bones and mastication rea his ears. Hellboy reacts to a smell, raises his eyes to  discover -- A huge pale CREATURE hangs from the ceiling, chewing slow SAMMAEL: equipped with powerful arms, a head full of tent and two well-muscled hind legs. Most of its face is hidde but the jaws are shiny with blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Stinky. Kitchen's closed. (beat) Whatcha havin'? Six library guards,  raw? Plus belts and boots? Man, you're  gonna need some heavy fiber to move  that out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in earphone) Red, I found something --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abe has found a small, medieval engraving of Sammael in o of the books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's not much here: the entity's  name is Sammael, the desolate one,  son of Nergal --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sammael releases himself, lands on the floor. Part of the neck is exposed: white, slimy skin, cracked like old marb and criss- crossed with blue veins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it -- (beat) Hey, Sammy, whaddayasay we work this  out?? Peacefully. I'm not a great  shot, but -- (raises his gun) "The Samaritan" here, uses really  big bullets, so whadyasay we work  this out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sammael stands and turns around -- CRACK-KKK!!! His waist twists him 360 degrees!! Screeching, Sammael leaps away!!! Hellboy shoots. The high-caliber ammo rips a few columns  apart and finally catches Sammael. The bullet goes throug it and destroys a statue and a large window behind him. T monster squeals and goes down. With a rattling cough, it  grows still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all for you, Sammy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in earpiece) Red -- you need to hear the rest of  the information --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy turns away for a moment. Puts his gun away, like gunslinger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah -- he's taken care of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, listen this: Sammael, the desolate  one, lord of the shadows, son of  Nergal --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hound of resurrection --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? I don't like that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Hound of resurrection?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy looks back at the corpse: it's gone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: harbinger of pestilence, seed of  destruction --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skip to the end, willya?  How do I  kill it -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't say --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAMMM!! From out of nowhere, Sammael appears and swings a arm!! Hellboy CRASHES into the brass doors!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors bulge and crack under Hellboy's impact. Abe and Broom backpedal fast. Myers pulls out his gun, an starts looking for another way in. Broom observes this,  pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sammael lashes out with a massive punch. HELLBOY goes K-KKRASH!!! K-KKRASH!!! through SIX glass  cabinets, then hits a window, falling --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- two stories down, landing sideways in an industrial ga bin. Hellboy fights to stay conscious. Blood drips from h mouth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Child...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy looks up: standing in the alley, like an appariti is Grigory, in a black suit and overcoat, his eyes shield by pitch-black sunglasses

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All grown up, I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy's in shock, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That voice --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sang the first lullaby you ever  heard, my child. I ushered you into  this world. (beat) I alone know your true calling, your  true name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me, it's Zeppo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy catches sight of his big gun, lying on the ground He goes for it but, BAMMM!!!! SAMMAEL lands before him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see that you're still young  and don't know your place. (turns to Sammael) Teach him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Hellboy can reach the weapon -- WSHHHP!!! A 7-foot tongue lashes out from Sammael's mouth like a whip. It's arm-thick, with yellow sacs billowing f its sides. It wraps around Hellboy's right arm. Hellboy falls to the ground, writhing, grinding his teeth The tongue squeezes and pulls. Smoke pours from Hellboy's skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then -- BANG! BANG! BANG! Myers appears at the end of the alley, firing round after round into Sammael's tongue. AM BLOOD explodes in the air. The tongue recoils with an inf

dialogues.speaker: SQUEAL
dialogues.text: Hellboy manages to roll away. Myers goes for HELLBOY's gun... and grabs it! He takes co behind the trash container. HELLBOY is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think you're doing??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myers proudly shows him the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helping you -- I just --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one ever helps me. It's my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs his gun and tries to reload, but his arm hurts t much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn -- Okay. Here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands him the gun and a fresh clip. Reaching into his  belt, Hellboy extracts a vacuum-sealed packet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (throws it at Myers) -- Then load this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the packet: A SINGLE BULLET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a tracking bullet. Crack the  pin. Load it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KLANG!!! The tongue punches through the steel like a ramr Again and again... Hellboy and Myers can barely dodge it. Myers cracks a safety pin. The glass head on the bullet g like a chemical flare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez... What the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's looking at Hellboy's smoking arm. Inside a bloody ga a big, black stinger is gleaming. Hellboy pulls it out, then steps on it. It pops like a ri grape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme go ask --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy steps from behind the container. Sammael's tongue instantly wraps around the gun's muzzle. BAM! BAM! Hellboy shoots repeatedly. His face lit weirdly green as the tracking bullet lodges within the gun. Then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The glowing bullet flies through the barrel and out towar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Sammael, still in mid-air. It hits him square in the chest: an explosion of green go With a shriek, the thing leaps over a wall. Hellboy scram after it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the empty sidewalk, Hellboy sees a trail of GLOWING GO He hits full stride, following it around a corner. Myers  lands a second later, cradling his arm, chasing after him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! No, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: LOADING DOCK / ALLEY
dialogues.text: Sammael dashes by, followed closely by Hellboy, running f tilt. A ten-wheeler backs up, effectively blocking their way. A few workers load pumpkin boxes in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is that??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without slowing down, Sammael jumps onto the trailer, den the roof then jumping off and into a CROWDED CARNIVAL are A small carrousel and refreshment stand flank a pumpkin p Full of curiosity, Sammael pauses a second to inspect a T or-treater dressed as a GOLDEN DRAGON. Hellboy catapults himself onto the trailer's roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chorus) Whoa-whoa-whoa-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy jumps and lands heavily on top of the driver's ca

dialogues.speaker: CRASH
dialogues.text: The driver is almost crushed under the steel. He screams, showered by thousands of glass shards. Myers is a few steps behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into headset) We'll hit the street in a minute.  We're heading towards civilians...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He squeezes between the vehicle and the alley wall. The  vendors are yelling at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, crazy costume, uh? Trick  or treat!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sammael runs past a group of trick-or-treaters, and jumps straight into the street. Cars swerve, avoiding a collisi as Sammael lands on the opposite sidewalk. The TRICK OR  TREATERS scream. Hellboy appears. He too dives straight into the traffic a Myers follows -- He runs into the road... and a 4X4 speeds straight at him Seeing this, Hellboy runs back, and lands next to Myers,  holds out his STONE HAND and stops the 4x4 dead in its tr The impact somersaults the car over them both. It lands w a thud on the street, air bags exploding. Myers almost fa Other cars stop, tires squealing and horns blaring. A maj traffic jam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myers opens his eyes, nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Stay here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves after Sammael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy follows the GLOWING GOOP into an adjacent alley. the far end he sees a metal grate has been moved. Sammael gone. He comes up to the opening, then jumps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lands on a subway track. Sammael is a few yards away.  Seated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiting for me, Sammy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A train horn blares. A headlight approaches!! Hellboy smi and puts away his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh -- between a rock and a hard  place --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Sammael sprints towards it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, crap --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sammael unhinges a long, scythe-like bone from his forear then jumps at the front car --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: smashing through glass and steel and raining sparks. Land inside with a ROAR!!! --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAMMAEL's tongue punches through the doors as he races th one -- two -- passenger cars and out the --

dialogues.speaker: STUNT TRACK REAR 1/4 CAR
dialogues.text: -- rear of the train, back onto the tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landing there safely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the train hurtles at Hellboy, who grimaces and does h best --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaps, but HUMPF!! He's hit! His legs rattle over the  tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inches from the wheels, he punches his stone hand through the steel floor and grabs a handhold. Steam and sparks ex everywhere. The TRAIN DRIVER grabs a fire extinguisher and starts sla it against Hellboy's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Hey! I'm on your side!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAMMM!!! He goes under!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train whizzes overhead, grazing his horn stumps, maki sparks fly!! After the train passes, Hellboy sits up, for smoking. Sammael is gone. A trail of GOOP is glowing. He  follows it, until it ends abruptly. He looks ahead: no trace of Sammael... Then a fat drop of glowing goop hits his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, I forgot --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up. Sammael hangs from the ceiling, then drops.  Then the creature lifts Hellboy in a ferocious bear hug. Hellboy twists around and cracks open the jaws of the  creature, like King Kong and the T-Rex. Sammael staggers back and -- in an impossible maneuver, r knits his jaws together! Then he uses his bone scythe to  tackle Hellboy and -- TCHAKKKK!! -- pin his shoulder down deep wound. Sammael's mouth starts to open! Hellboy looks at the spar THIRD RAIL a few feet away. Sammael's tongue rears back, a snake ready to strike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy grabs the rail. An electrical discharge consumes  both creatures and burns the frame like flashpaper. Hellb lets go, his hand and body smoking. Sammael -- very crisp is convulsing in a cloud of smoke. He grows still. Wreathed in smoke, Hellboy shakes off the shock and uses flame on his arm to light a cigar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fireproof. (puffs smoke, kicks  the body) You weren't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge traffic jam clogs the highway. The totalled 4X4 is being TOWED AWAY. Several TV CREWS interview witnesses. Myers -- his arm freshly bandaged -- signs a police form. His radio beeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myers??? How's your arm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My arm is fine. Where are you??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myers moves away from the POLICE OFFICERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto voce) Where are you???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy walks away from the smoking Sammael carcass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just fried Stinky. Tell Father  I'll be home. He shouldn't wait up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait -- Wait -- You can't go anywhere --  I gotta go with you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no, it's fine: I do my job,  I take a break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Stop. Don't do this -- Listen to  me -- Tell me where you are --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns off his belt locator and moves away into the dar of the tunnel. In the foreground: BLACK light escapes from Sammael's cha body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An abandoned shower room. A series of sinks and stalls, l with dirty white tile. A phonograph nearby plays Wagner.  Kroenen stands next to it. ILSA is nearby, a straight razor glinting in her hand. Sh stands over Grigory -- his back to us -- lovingly shaving her master's scalp. She grabs two GLASS EYES from a table Places them in Grigory's sockets -- his back to us -- as turns, a glass eye shifts lazily into position. He opens hand: in it the pale BLACK light that escaped from Sammae body. He cradles it like a precious stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Sammael has fulfilled his destiny...  Die in peace and be reborn again and  again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He closes his fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only seven more days to the eclipse,  Grishka...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rasputin stands, his neck and shoulders rising, engorged moving flesh beneath his human skin. Ilsa stares in  fascination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The child will be there. And so will  we all -- Won't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him, in the darkness of a tunnel: TWO SAMMAEL  silhouettes appear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sleek black limo drives past the crowd and stops outsid FBI agent TOM MANNING emerges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manning and Broom walk through the mess. A crew is cleani up. The dead guards are carried out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every time the media get a look at  him, they come to me. I'm running  out of lies, Trevor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you liked being on TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. (beat) How many escapes?  This year alone:  five!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom -- he's our guest, not a prisoner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your "guest" happens to be six foot  five, bright red, and is government  funded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just going through a phase --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manning moistens and lights a fine cigar, using a kitchen match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A "phase"? What do you think this  is, "The Brady Bunch?" These... freaks --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABE SAPIEN listens while pacing the exhibition hall, palm open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lowers his voice,  tense) These freaks, Trevor, they give me  the creeps. And I'm not the only  one. You're up for review. You and  your petting zoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know where to find him. I'll get  him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manning watches as Abe finds a sharp dagger embedded in t floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, fishstick -- don't touch anything --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abe silences him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to touch it to "see"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See what??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The past, the future, whatever this  object holds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes Broom) Is he serious??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about fingerprints. I  never had any.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abe holds the dagger in his hand, turns to Broom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were over here, Professor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh!! Who was here? Nixon? Houdini?  You mind sharing your mystic insights?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broom examines the dagger: a RAGNAROK symbol crowns the h The dragon and swastika.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me, Abe... show me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He solemnly extends his hand. As soon as Abe takes it, th room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hours earlier: the place is intact. Both ABE and BROOM wi spectrally as -- A GUARD CHECKS AN ALARM MONITORING UNIT. HEARING A tickin sound, he shines his light into a dark corner: no one's t But after the guard moves on, a spidery form emerges from the pool of shadows on the floor. It's KROENEN, encased in shiny BLACK LATEX from head to t On his chest, a close-fitting harness comprised of softly ticking gears. He approaches a glass case which holds an ancient WOODEN  STATUE of an Eastern Orthodox SAINT. Then, on the glass, a reflection: ILSA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She uses her hammer to destroy the glass case. The ALARM shrieks. Warning lights come on. Kroenen pulls out a double-ended BLADE. It spins, like a  giant bone saw, slicing across the statue. No apparent damage until: CRACKKKKK!!! a diagonal line ap and the top half falls. KROENEN reaches for a small crank embedded in his chest a winds himself up. Ilsa reaches into a hollow portion in the wooden statue a removes a large reliquary jar containing Golden sand. Six guards hurry in. They point their flashlights and gun at Kroenen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You! Don't move! Hands up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kroenen starts shaking, as if in a seizure and readies tw TWIN BLADES. bullet tears into Kroenen's arm, spewing forth an explosi of dust. He turns. The guards shoot again. Kroenen maneuv the steel, deflecting the bullets which -- -- ricochet wildly -- and finally hit three of the guards They fall silently to the floor. Kroenen dispatches two more in a flurry of knives. The last guard raises his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something is clearly stopping him. His hand breaks, twist by an unseen force!! The flesh on his neck pushes upwards, held by an invisibl force. He starts floating in mid-air. The blinking lights of arriving police cars tint the wind red and amber. They outline a figure formerly submerged i shadows. GRIGORY. He gestures with both hands, as if hold an imaginary doll. His arm muscles twitch under his skin, shifting, changing gaining strength. With a quick gesture Grigory twists the lower and upper p of the guard's body in opposite directions. With a wet CRUNCH, the guard's shadow on the wall goes li Grigory looks at Ilsa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready the welcome, my love --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ilsa opens the reliquary jar and pours a circle of sand o the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salt. Gathered from the tears of a  thousand martyrs. Restraining the  essence of Sammael, the hell hound,  the seed of destruction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grigory slices the air with his open hand, creating fleet glyphs... and a small BLACK flame dances on his open palm He deposits it in mid-air, at the center of the circle. Then, the sand begins to move, like liquid mercury. Lines fuse into a pile. It melts and bubbles, growing and foami Bones are formed, tendons and ligaments join together,  GROWING, GROWING, INTO SAMMAEL. It roars!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abe snaps out of it. Broom is pale. He steps away, wincin enduring a bolt of pain in his side. Abe holds him. Motio for the others to stay back. He extends his open palm and "feels" the air near the old man's back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor..? You -- are very sick --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want Hellboy to know --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broom turns around, gently pushes Abe's hand away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixty years ago Abe, they tried to  destroy the world. And they are back --  in my lifetime, they are back. To  finish the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small nighttime Halloween celebration. Lanterns hanging from the trees, couples drinking and listening to Pop mus on picnic tables. On a bench, A YOUNG GUY pulls out a cold SIX PACK of beer and passionately kisses his GIRLFRIEND. As he shuts his e a bright, red tail neatly snatches the six-pack. Behind the bench, HELLBOY smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dry leaves fly up in a gust of wind. A small army of EMER VEHICLES roars down the deserted streets, right past a... ...brick 1940's HOSPITAL, behind a high wall topped with  barbed wire. The mesh-covered windows are decorated with  paper skeletons and jack-o'-lanterns. A topiary garden  surrounds the building. Watching from atop the wall is HELLBOY. One sleeve of his overcoat is soaked in blood. He keeps an eye on the SECON FLOOR windows. Hanging from his tail: THE SIX PACK OF BEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOCTOR MARSH, a female psychiatrist, moves down a line  patients, distributing pills. Behind her, a lithe young woman in a patient's gown carri the medicine tray. This is LIZ SHERMAN, age 26, her pale  skin contrasting with her raven-black hair and piercing d eyes. A scar mars her forehead. Three thick rubber bands  circle her wrist. Near a window, a Down's Syndrome PATIENT senses something

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) There's a big red guy down there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (readying more pills) That's fine, darling, Santa's not  here for another month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not Santa. Big and red. With gold  eyes. And he has beer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearing this, Liz stops. She closes her eyes, tugs at one the rubber bands on her wrist and lets it snap against he skin. She winces and peers out the window. The garden bel seems empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz steps out a side door into the hospital garden. Hangi from her neck: an old POLAROID CAMERA. She follows a trai of blood to a large, thorny bush. As she circles it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back so soon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visible in the branches, a leg and part of Hellboy's over His tail emerges, dangling the six-pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, I brought beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz shoots a Polaroid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To wash down my lithium pills? (beat) I may get a few perks, H.B. But I'm  still a patient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shyly, he climbs out from the bush. She sees the bloody a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better have that looked at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a scratch. (shrug) I wanted to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy's sitting on a bench, next to Liz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We miss you at the Bureau. Abe's  crazier every day. And Father's still  mad at me -- (Liz smiles) Come back, Liz. Come back. I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not this time, H.B. It's been  months since I've had an episode.  And you know what? I'm learning to  control it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Around her right hand a faint BLUE AURA of fire blooms,  crawling over her fingers like a velvet haze. She stares the pale flame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm learning where it comes from. (beat) And for once in my life I'm not  afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She clenches her fist and puts the flame out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like your ride is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garbage truck and the two black sedan cars have pulle into the hospital grounds. A dozen agents climb out of th vehicles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nanny Squad.

dialogues.speaker: THE CARS
dialogues.text: Clay starts towards Hellboy, but Myers stops him and turn to Broom:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, may I go first??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Broom) Not so fast. He barely knows him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cuts him off) Then he should make it his business  to change that.

dialogues.speaker: THE BENCH
dialogues.text: Liz stands up, puts her hand on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, H.B. I've got a chance out  here. If you truly care about me,  don't come back anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy smiles sadly. She walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't turn back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I gotta go, too. Lots to do --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feeling light-headed, he stands up. On the bench and at h feet, a pool of his own blood. He sees Myers tentatively approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What took you so long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, time to go home. Tape you up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you, a Boy Scout?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I never was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weak) Could've fooled me. Go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy drops to his knees. Clay, Quarry and Moss reach h Help him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, champ. You look a little woozy,  there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This -- ? This is nothing. You know  what'll kill me? (points at the doorway) Her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz stands at the hospital door and sees Hellboy keel ove A few of the agents help him to the vehicles. Myers looks back at Liz. They hold each others' gaze, the unfamiliar faces filled with curiosity. Eventually, she g inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the depths of the B.P.R.D infirmary, Hellboy lies flat a stainless steel table. Broom sits alongside him. Abe peers through a magnifier at Hellboy's wounded arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were burned by some organic acid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm lucky that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using a scalpel, Abe probes the gash. Hellboy lets out a  GRUNT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son. About Rasputin --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I'll get him soon enough --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me. This time is different.  There's more at stake than ever  before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How hard can it be? I punched the  crap out of that thing that he sent --  ouch!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I worry about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?? C'mon --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I won't be around forever, you  know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, stop that -- (grimaces in pain) Damn! Be careful, there --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red. How long was it latched onto  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno, maybe five seconds -- ow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to hold him down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snickers) That's right, Stud, hold me down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broom moves to Abe's side of the table. Abe is poking at depths of the wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharp, to Hellboy) Don't look! Turn around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broom comes closer, eyes wide: inside the wound on Hellbo forearm, nestled like ticks, are 3 translucent EGGS. Hellboy jumps as Abe plucks the first one out. Abe deposi it in a glass container.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Touched you five seconds. Laid three  eggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't even buy me a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The computer beeps having finished an analysis. On a moni an enlarged color image of one of the throbbing eggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The eggs are very sensitive to heat  and light. They need a humid, dark  environment to breed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abe picks up an egg with a pair of tweezers, passes it on Hellboy, who sports a bandage on his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down there. Did you ever loose track  of him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let's see -- there was that  moment, when I had a train on top of  my head --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broom frowns, worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hellboy) We can't risk it: You'll go back to  the tracks tomorrow with a group of  agents, search the area, top to  bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myers observes, repelled, as inside the egg a small foeta THING wiggles. INT. BROOMВґS OFFICE - NIGHT Myers stands by Broom's desk as the old man places a new of books on the reading stands in front of the fish tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in way over my head, I know that  much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're doing fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the last book stand, Broom glances at Abe, who is sitt in the shadows near the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not. He respects Clay. Not  me. I don't know why you chose me,  Sir. But I'm not qualified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Discouraged, Myers heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very quiet) I'm dying Agent Myers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shocked, Myers looks over at Broom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as a father, I worry about him. (directly to Myers) In medieval stories, Agent Myers,  there's often a young knight,  inexperienced but pure of heart...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, please. I'm not "pure of heart."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I ask from you is -- Have the  courage to stand by his side after  I'm gone. Help him find himself. Who  he must be. (beat) He was born a Demon... You will help  him become a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dozens of HELLBOY clippings flash by: tabloid headlines a with intimate images of Hellboy as a KID. H.B. at 7, at 1 dressed as a human for Halloween, Broom by his side.
