Myers works at a computer workstation. He brings up a small photograph in an old issue of The  Enquirer. The headline: "ARSON SUSPECT NOW WORKING FOR SE GOVERNMENT AGENCY" There's a photo of a woman, taken with telephoto lens. Another clipping: young LIZ, 11, and a photo of a tenemen building burned to the ground: TRAGIC EXPLOSION. A QUICKTIME interview pops up. LIZ, in her early twenties caption reads: ELIZABETH SHERMAN, first interview, BPRD,  PYROKINETIC. She has a POLAROID camera in her hands. Shoo one at the lens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like the term "firestarter."  I just don't. And "Pyrokinesis" sounds  like psychosis or something. I dunno --  maybe that's right. Not being able  to let go -- (shrug) Scary. Sometimes you hear so-and-so  lost control and just exploded. (beat) They're lucky it isn't true. (looks at the camera) With me -- it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two strolling ORDERLIES shine their flashlights inside th rooms on both sides of a long corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flashlight beam sweeps Liz's room. It illuminates a  CORKBOARD covered with hundreds of Polaroids depicting sc of everyday life. When the beam of light crosses her face, she turns slowly still asleep. As the light fades, the shadows in the room grow deeper.  Grigory emerges from a dark corner. He gazes down on the  bed, extending his right hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Master is calling your name now,  my girl. We are all part of his plan.  You must return to the child... So,  once again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gently caresses the scar on her forehead. Under his sk a hideous movement, a writhing rearrangement of muscles. fingers start to glow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...dream of fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz convulses. A small ripple of heat rises from her fore

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somewhere in a smokestack city, grown-ups and kids hang  banners and prepare a ragged birthday party in a cement  courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Sitting on some tenement steps, LIZ, age 11. Sullen, alon a gold CRUCIFIX hanging on her chest. A WOMAN -- Liz's MOTHER -- comes down the courtyard steps carrying a basket of apples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Liz) Liz!! Liz!! Come on, darling, give  Mummy a hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearby, under a balloon archway, munching candy-coated  apples... three KIDS giggle and point at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freak!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz turns to see them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his friend) See? She knows her name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz shies away from them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go home, you freak. We don't want  you here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start throwing stones. One hits the steps. Another m her by inches. A third hits her in the shoulder. Scared, Liz turns but a rock catches her full on the face She falls down, blood trickling from her forehead, splatt the pavement. She starts sobbing. Another rock sails acro but this time, in mid-air, it catches fire and turns to a A ripple of heat starts crawling up Liz's hands. Soon a p blue flame rings her entire arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sobbing) Not again, please, not again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Firelight glints off the crucifix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOTHER is dunking the apples in a pot of caramel. A  heartbreaking cry reaches her ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy! Mommy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother sees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz: outlined by licking flames!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicked) Mommy! Help me! I'm burning!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother screams, horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help meee!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She then explodes. A white-hot supernova engulfs the  courtyard. Her mother's body burns like flash paper. Then the rest of the people are --

dialogues.speaker: THE ENTIRE TENEMENT COURTYARD
dialogues.text: -- devoured by an explosion of atomic proportions. Benche people, trees. Everything. The four surrounding apartment blocks collapse as a shock wave hits like a wrecking ball The frame whites out. And at ground zero there is but one figure left standing: Liz... a little girl, still crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz screams, her back arching, her body now in flames. He chest glows, silhouetting organs and ribs. The rubber bands on her wrist vaporize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The glow from Liz's room streams into the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In their glass kiosk, two ORDERLIES are listening to the  radio and sharing a pizza. A red light flashes repeatedly a panel. They silence the radio, grab their batons and get up. A l rumble shakes the room. Through the VIBRATING glass window they see...

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR MINIATURE / COMPOSITE
dialogues.text: ...A BALL OF FLAME pushing inexorably through the corrido The inside of the glass booth is absolutely silent, makin the vision both terrifying and strangely serene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the glass explodes, the fire ROARS, drowning everythin The orderlies hit the floor, taking cover under a shelf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The top floor blows up. Flame pours out of every window,  showering glass into the streets below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myers pushes the breakfast cart. On it, three dozen panca and a mound of bacon and toast. He opens the door to HellboyВґs den.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside, Hellboy is leaning over Broom, glaring at the old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many buildings does she have to  burn? She belongs here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not how she feels. She may  never feel it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myers enters, deliberately clearing his throat. They igno him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's her choice -- (beat) She's human --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, as opposed to -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broom grows silent. Hellboy stomps over to a mirror and -- using a hand-held  belt sander -- savagely shaves his horns. Sparks fly ever time he goes at the round stumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmh -- "Pamcakes." We're going out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor, that girl you were talking  about --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whirls around) Hey. You: think twice --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I can help -- Talk to her --  I can bring her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chuckles) What landed you this job, pushing  "pamcakes"? Punctuality? What was  your area of expertise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myers murmurs --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hostage negotiations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy's face lights up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Part of the building is demolished. Repair crews and fire are still hosing down smoldering piles of debris. Myers arrives in a taxi cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myers looks at LIZ through a see-through mirror. She sits a bench inside a padded cell. A security CAMERA AND MONIT records her constantly. A worried-looking Dr. Marsh stands alongside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's been like this since it  happened. There were no casualties.  But it's put a big dent in our  Thorazine supply... (dubious look at Myers) Are you sure you want to go in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myers nods, loosens his tie and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz doesn't acknowledge Myers' presence. He kneels and lo up at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Sherman? I'm Agent Myers, FBI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Sherman? I'm Agent Myers, FBI. (no response) The hospital called us. They don't  feel they're capable of caring for  you any longer, and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz -- can I call you Liz? It's a  beautiful name --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs) 60% OF THE WOMEN IN THIS WORLD ARE  NAMED "LIZ".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's still impressive by my standards:  My name's John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him. He offers his hand. She looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Broom asked me to invite you  back to the Bureau. No special  precautions, no security escorts.  You and me in a taxi. Like regular  folks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't sounds like him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Sherman, he's asking you back,  but it's entirely your choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz turns to the 2-way mirror. Both their reflections are there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Choice, huh? That's cute. I've quit  the Bureau thirteen times. I always  go back. (snaps two rubber  bands) Where else would I go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An explosion of sound and light as a subway train passes  through a dank tunnel. Then, light beams sweep the encrus walls and steel columns. Clay and some B.P.R.D. agents hold flashlights. Two of th MOSS and QUARRY -- carry FLAMETHROWERS. Hellboy and Abe bring up the rear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter a store room piled high with filing cabinets,  typewriters and school desks. A turn-of-the-century mural depicts happy boys doing charitable acts. A Latin phrase  ("VIRILITER AGE") encourages them to behave like men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reads a map) We're in the cellar of the Benjamin  Institute. Turn-of-the-century  orphanage. Closed since they moved  the sewers in '51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abe removes his gloves, hyperextends his palm and senses air. Then the surface of the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a pulse. And it's coming  from --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debris and dust seem to float from the water's surface an towards Abe's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: there --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They point their flashlights at a bulkhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cistern on the other side. Most of  the eggs are there --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move some filing cabinets and stare at a blank concr wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should go back and request  permission to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAMMM!!! Hellboy's stone hand cracks the concrete. He sta pounding, again and again, like a jack hammer.

dialogues.speaker: INT., (SET/LOCATION BUILT SUGAR FACTORY)
dialogues.text: Makeshift living quarters tucked below a maze of furnace  ducts. Scores of old clocks fill the room with TICKING. At a desk, Kroenen calmly repairs a mechanical hand: his  own. His face is partly exposed. Under his leather mask, horri lidless eyes glitter over a skull-like grin, made of raw  gums and taut skin. As Hellboy's pounding reaches his ears, he rises, like a  spider whose web has twitched. The mechanical hand rattle blindly on the table. He opens an ancient leather folder and extracts an engrav depicting Sammael. Carefully places it on the table. Then opens a drawer and, from an envelope, takes two torn piec of paper. He puts them in a pouch in his belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wall collapses under Hellboy's attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you coming or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay smiles uncertainly back. Hellboy moves in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Quarry and Moss) You two, check this dump, then join  us --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large oval room of rusting metal, with pipes spilling w through a large GRATE on the floor. Abe studies it, senses something, and nods. With superhum effort, Hellboy lifts it. Hundreds of roaches pour out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad I'm not human. This place  would be an embarrassment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below, a vast cistern. Abe drops in two CHEMICAL FLARES.

dialogues.speaker: CHAMBER, (SET TANK)
dialogues.text: The flares sink, illuminating floating office furniture a torn paper...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the lower depths, they pass shadowy industrial ruins.  Settling on the bottom they reveal the hulk of a waiting  SAMMAEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abe pulls off his breathing apparatus. Activates the loca on his utility belt. Hellboy does likewise. BEEEP! The de synchronize. Hellboy extends a metal reliquary containing a small bone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go, Doctor. This should  cover your tailfin -- On loan from  the Vatican, a bone from Saint  Dionysius. Ugh. Looks like a pinky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abe ties the reliquary around his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remind me why I keep doing this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rotten eggs and the safety of mankind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As transparent nictomembrane lids cover his eyes, Abe div

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Underwater, ABE finds an entire control room. 1940's maga float by, like paper jellyfish. The amber light of the  chemical flares gives the room an eerie other-worldly fee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiting above, Hellboy chews a Baby Ruth and pokes around Finds a pile of children's shoes covering some yellowing  albums. In the albums, a myriad of sad faces, the orphans from the past. Some of the faces have been cut out. There's an unfinishe letter to Father Christmas, dated 1866. Clay stands below a grate, admiring his hair implants wit hand mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? It's thicker. Isn't it? It's  not that doll-hair thing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, something moves. Hellboy shines his light into adjoining tunnel. Kroenen is standing there, like a deer  caught in headlights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figure darts away. Hellboy tears after it, gun in han

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red, wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay tries his radio. Static.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red's on the move!! I'll cover him!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls out his gun and runs after Hellboy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay arrives at an intersection of sewer tunnels. The glo of Hellboy's flashlight is visible somewhere ahead, his  booming footsteps rapidly receding. A veritable labyrinth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it, Red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abe nears the bottom of the cistern. As his feet touch bo a cloud of silt fogs the water. He picks out a translucen egg! Suddenly, something big glides by. Abe turns: sees nothin He places the egg in a glass canister. Now eggs are float everywhere, undulating in the water like amber fireflies. Abe swims slowly, collecting them one by one. Some of them are snugly wedged between two rusty machines Abe's reliquary gets caught in a lever and snaps loose!! lands -- on a grate on the floor. Abe swims down and tries to grab it, but it falls through. Abe curses and stands up -- -- only to find himself FACE TO FACE with Sammael!! The monster rakes Abe across the chest; dark blue blood b to flow. Abe shoves himself into a long, concrete fissure Sammael can't fit through, but the tongue darts out, miss Abe by inches. Sammael scratches at the walls, trying to  reach deeper, screaming in rage. Abe screams too, emitting a trail of bubbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bubbles burst on the surface. Watching them is a SECO SAMMAEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy stops, disoriented. No trace of KROENEN. He sniff the air, then steps through a non-descript portal.

dialogues.speaker: INT., (LOCATION/BUILT SUGAR FACTORY)
dialogues.text: Hellboy stands in Kroenen's quarters. An array of gas mas dangle from ducts overhead. Glued next to the walls are d of old photos of children. He discovers the Sammael engraving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Sammael: seed of destruction. Death  becomes the fertile ground."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly: drool drops from above: Sammael hangs from a be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning) Didn't I kill you already?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sammael lunges, hurling Hellboy through an open service  shaft... ...and it's a long way down. When Sammael leaps, Hellboy throws him over the edge. Sam however, grabs Hellboy's tail and pulls him over the side

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They crash through pipes, wiring and ducts and slide off  down a duct and into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: another passage. There they bounce off of dripping water  pipes and jutting steel I beams, until they finally break through a mesh/insulation ceiling and directly onto --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A subway platform. Full of people. The two fighting creatures land on the ticket booth -- in explosion of coins, glass and steel!!! Some bold New York in the crowd start picking up handfuls of change. The dust clears, revealing a large crater in the platform floor. Sammael hits Hellboy. The Red Giant lands on a line of  turnstiles, uprooting them all. Sammael flies through the air, unfolds its bone scythe.  Hellboy rolls away. Sammael misses: the tip imbeds itself the floor and then -- TCHAKKK!!! -- in a concrete column. Sammael pulls, bringing down part of the ceiling. More SC from the fleeing public. A mezzanine above Hellboy collapses, bringing the ceiling steel cables and office furniture down onto the Red Giant Sammael takes a step towards the crowd and roars -- Then, BAMMMMMM!!! A desk flies up into the air. Hellboy's stone hand emerges, triumphant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Chunk-face!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He climbs out of the crater. Sammael growls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do better than that. Big  monster like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy rips off one of the turnstile bars and hits Samma again and again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? It hurts! You shouldn't hit  people!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sammael blocks the last hit and throws the bar away. It e itself in the tile wall. Sammael punches Hellboy, a hard uppercut. Hellboy flies up, crashing through the plate glass of a s mezzanine above the platform. He skids on the tile floor, scraping a jagged line with his stone hand. He slides past a group of BYSTANDERS and into a row of ba subway ads. He lands in a shower of glass and debris on a wooden bench, breaking it in two. Sammael climbs up into the mezzanine. Hellboy gets up -- his back bristling with glass shards - and hears a WAIL: a YOUNG GIRL is pointing at A BOX OF KI abandoned on a bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My kittens!! My kittens!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, crap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sammael charges!!! Hellboy scoops up the box, holds it hi Using his bone blade, Sammael pulverizes the bench. Next, Sammael slashes at Hellboy, scattering a dozen shri citizens. Illuminated by sparks and shorting lamps, Hellboy advance blood dripping from his forehead and nose. Hellboy starts to reload, but -- Sammael's tongue shoots  out. Hellboy throws the kitten box in the air and -- trap the tongue with his stone hand --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Second date. No tongue!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- while catching the box with his tail. The kittens are  fine. Using the tongue, he throws Sammael out a glass window. Sammael dangles above the tracks, but he re-joints himsel and grabs a handhold on the train wall above the tunnel.  From here, he pulls on Hellboy, sliding him toward the ja glass. Sammael pulls harder, enters the tunnel. Hellboy fights to free himself, but his sweaty face is  millimeters away from being sliced by the glass. All seem lost, when... WHAAAAA!!!!!! A train appears out of nowhere heading stra for Sammael. It splatters the thing against the tunnel wall and plows Sammael's body sprawls motionless at the side of the trac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope that hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives the cats to the young girl --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy approaches Sammael, whose remains are wreathed in BLACK flame. A huge CROWD looks on from the end of the  platform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a whisper) This time. Stay dead, willya??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves away. The BLACK flame flickers out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the water, BLACK light blooms within TWO OF SAMMAEL EGGS as a fantastic methamorphosis starts. The embryos bu out, gyrating in the water, swelling and distending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Badly wounded, Abe peers from his hiding spot. Sammael's there. He quickly swims to the surface, his weird blue blood tra behind him. The water boils with energy and BLACK LIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abe staggers out of the pool and hides behind a crumbling shower stall. Behind him, two SHAPES come to the surface. Shaking, Abe pushes his belt locator and collapses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy's locator belt crackles to life. BLUE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abe -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in the tunnel, Quarry and moss move filing cabinets rotten bozes full of files. One of them gives out and pap spill all over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their locators light up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abe --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly -- a noise! The agents leap up and sweep their  flashlights over the columns... Nothing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moss, what the hell was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, TWO SILHOUETTES cast long shadows. Powerful footfal boom like thunderclaps. Agent Quarry raises his gun and fires at the dark shapes. Useless: the things plow on. Moss hurriedly straps on his flame thrower. After a few  seconds, a green light beeps, READY. The muzzle of the flamethrower vomits a 30 feet long gout fire into the blackness. The men pause: silence! Quarry turns on his flashlight, hand trembling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever it was --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM!!! SAMMAEL'S TONGUE uncurls from the shadows and land on Quarry's face, pulling him into the dark. His flashlig bobbles and strobes, lighting up a nightmare: TWO SAMMAELS stand in the tunnel. One of them gleefully  squeezes Quarry. The man's screams are muffled by the  creature's fleshy lips wrapping around his head. Moss runs as fast as he can, jumping and tumbling through obstacle course of beams. Turning, he readies the  flamethrower. The SECOND SAMMAEL lands on Moss's back,  breaking his spine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy enters to find Abe, bleeding but alive, leaning  against the tile, blue blood all around him. Hellboy trie his walkie-talkie. Turns on his locator. It sparks. It's  damaged and broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his walkie-talkie) We need an ambulance. Now!! Over!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay stumbles around, lost. He stops under a grate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the walkie-talkie) Who's there? Clay? Come in, someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay, Code 30, this is Clay, over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Clay, Kroenen drops down from an overhead pipe, th shafts of gray light. He brings forth his customary long  blade. Clay turns in time to see Kroenen coming at him. H fires. Kroenen stabs. Twin rivulets of blood run from Clay's nostrils.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy hears the gunfire, starts running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay falls to the floor. Kroenen stands there, unfazed by Clay's bullets in his ch Dust pours from his wounds and piles up neatly at his fee He hears Hellboy coming.He places the knife on the floor, then lies down and plays dead. Hellboy appears at the end of the tunnel. He glances at  Kroenen's body, then quickly checks for a pulse on Clay. Hellboy looks demolished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ethnic pop song blasts from the taxi radio. Liz pokes head out of the window and shoots a Polaroid snapshot. Sh passes it to Myers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It feels good to be outside!! It's  been so long...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't hear her over the music. Myers knocks on the  bulletproof acrylic divider.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!! The music!! Turn down the  music!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, music!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He merely changes the radio station; the music stays at t same volume. Myers looks back at Liz. She is halfway out the window, sitting on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus! That's not -- That's not safe,  Miss Sherman -- Miss Sherman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes another Polaroid and passes it down to him. Mye looks at the Polaroid, then smiles. He climbs out of the  other window, hands her the photograph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice view --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waves at her. For the first time, she smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smile, huh? That's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes his picture. With the cold morning wind blowing Liz's hair and the sun on her face, she looks beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get used to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myers taps his fingers on the roof, to the beat of the mu He can't take his eyes off her. They drive towards the BP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unconscious, Abe floats in a special tank. LED strips rea water temperature, pH level, etc. He's encased in a bio-c a cybernetic healing unit wrapped around his thorax and r arm. A web of tubes and hoses keeps him in place. SHIRTLESS and bandaged, Hellboy sits and studies him, as in a trance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll make it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy turns, Manning is there:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But not everyone was so lucky. (beat) Two agents died today. Clay probably  won't survive the night. You're  reckless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew those men better than you did --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, I see. That makes it all alright  then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to leave. Hellboy gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it doesn't make it right, but I  stopped that creature, didn't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you do. That's why we  need you. You have an insight. (beat) You know monsters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you trying to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the end, after you've killed and  captured every freak out there --  there's still one left: you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a deep sigh) I wish I could be more gracious but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAMMMMM!!!! He smashes a metal LOCKER with his stone hand and raises it above his head. Manning cowers, realizing that Hellboy's rage is a danger thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new space. Office corridors radiate out from a brass  B.P.R.D. logo on the floor. A few agents monitor computer stations and tactical glass boards. Liz and Myers walk in, carrying her suitcases. She looks  around and sees BROOM coming down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only for the weekend, Professor  Broom. Then I'll be on my way --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impeccable courtesy) Come and go as you please. (beat) Find your way back. We've made quite  a few changes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRASH!!! Liz screams and Myers draws his gun. Smashing th a glass partition, the mangled steel LOCKER lands in the  middle of the hall in a rain of glass and aluminum studs. Next, Manning appears, retreating but unharmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasping) I want that thing locked up, starting  now -- Now!!! You hear me                        !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Broom) Nothing's changed. Home, sweet home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mortified, Broom hurries after Manning. Hellboy calmly st through the hole in the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seeing her) Liz? Liz!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She spins on her heel and walks off. Hellboy turns to Mye

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You!!! You did it, buddy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myers holsters his gun and follows Liz. Hellboy is all al now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (oblivious) Woo hoo!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A familiar cell. Fireproof insulation covers the walls. L throws her bags on the bed. Myers lingers in the doorway. She reflexively pulls on one of the rubber bands on her w then lets it snap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little something I learned in  therapy. I'm depressed -- (snaps a rubber band) One rubber band. I'm impatient: two  rubber bands...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits by her side on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get you a fresh pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cat bats at a ball of paper. On it, two words are visib DEAR LIZ. Hellboy's tail scoops up the paper and throws i in a brimming wastebasket. He's sitting at a stainless steel desk, deep in concentra writing with evident difficulty. The floor around him is  covered with more crumpled pages. In the background, the  projector is showing DUCK SOUP. Myers pushes in a cartloa of CHILI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh! Just a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myers sets the tray on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myers, you're a talker. What's a  good word -- a solid word for "need" --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Need" is a good, solid word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, sounds too "needy."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start in, you got nachos coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he goes out, Liz appears in the doorway. Hellboy quick stops writing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (notices the small  feline army) Oh, my God... Look at them all! Who  had babies? C'mere, Tiger...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz plays with a cat. Hellboy lifts the piece of paper, w looks like a postage stamp in his stone hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... Liz -- I -- there's something  I'd like you to -- something I need  you to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. Is it long?? I'm going out,  but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out? Out out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a cup of coffee, but go ahead,  read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Myers is taking me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy stands up, walks towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Him!! Why him? Why not me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myers walks back in pushing a tray of nachos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hellboy) Hey, your chili's getting cold --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sits back down) Not hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you want me to hear -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy folds the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nothing. Just a list -- It's  not finished --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, okay then. Maybe later then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves. Myers smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything else you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snappy) Not from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well good n-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furious) Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under a sheet, Kroenen's cold, naked body lies on a slab. Broom talks into a tape recorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The subject: Karl Ruprecht Kroenen --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The visible areas of the body make us grateful for the sh covering the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suffered a masochistic compulsion  known as surgical addiction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The silver hand and harness lie on a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both eyelids were surgically removed  along with his upper and lower lips,  making speech impossible. The blood  in his veins dried up decades ago.  Only dust remains. (looks at an X-ray  film) Four pulverized vertebrae. A steel  rod inserted into his pelvis held  him up. (beat) What horrible will power could keep  a thing like this alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finds the small pieces of paper Kroenen planted in his pouch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the gaze of high-security cameras, AGENT LIME rolls Hellboy's food cart down the corridor and into the domed  intersection. He whistles a happy tune. Opens the high  security door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lime's jaw drops. Across the room, one of the walls has been completely  demolished, revealing a SERVICE SHAFT. No sign of Hellboy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lime peeks into the SERVICE SHAFT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myers and Liz leave a coffee shop, strolling down the str Myers hands Liz her coffee. They chat and laugh. He pushe his Moped. She has her Polaroid with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you two talking about. What's  so fascinating?? So important??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz and Myers pause at a corner, waiting for the light. T shops are closing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I admire him. He's a force of nature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just pushy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... He's determined. Unstoppable --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A brute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My uncle used to say... we like people  for their qualities but love them  for their defects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz half-smiles, sips her coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He -- loves you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know. Really. I grew up with  him. (beat) I've missed him too, but now, every  time I see him, I get confused. Hardly  a day goes by he's not in my mind.  Even now, I feel he's here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they walk down the street. A red streak jumps over roo tops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy lands neatly on the adjacent roof. He looks down Myers and Liz -- Myers offers her cream and sugar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No cream and sugar, moron. She takes  it black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes the coffee, waves off the half and half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toldya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying to feel superior, Hellboy chuckles. As they walk, gestures vigorously. His smile fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's freezing, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffee's warming me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By now, all the shops are closed. They approach a small p near a train track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do now? Newark, New Jersey,  entertainment capital of the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cleans off a wet, dirty bench, sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You offered me a cup of coffee. I've  got one, so just sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myers is falling for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy leaps off a building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two red hands appear over the rooftop parapet. Cursing,  Hellboy hauls himself up. He finds himself next to a pige coop where a YOUNG KID is feeding the birds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Hellboy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh. I'm... on a mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches as Liz and Myers sit on the bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell anyone, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broom examines the damage to the wall. He turns to see  Hellboy's locator belt hanging on the wall. Broom shakes head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we send out some scouts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broom motions for him to stop. It's useless,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Enough. He will never change --  always a child. Always.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kroenen's body lies on the table. Slowly, his chest start to rise and fall. He sits up. His arm stump docks into the prosthetic hand -- Click! He flexes the shiny fingers. Kroenen's hideous cranium is visible for an instant befor he zips up his mask. He takes the sharp Ragnarok knives a turns one over. It reflects a figure standing behind him: Grigory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pigeon kid walks towards Hellboy, carrying two glasse of milk and a plate of cookies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Mom baked 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits by Hellboy's side as he watches Liz and Myers cha and laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it: she's laughing. I'm done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy grabs three cookies off the plate and scarfs them down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't look like spies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! Look at him, those shifty  eyes, that -- phony grin...!! (seeing the last cookie) You gonna eat that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below, Myers yawns. Hellboy slaps his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, the yawning trick. That's so  1950's! Watch his arm --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks around, picks up a pebble, hefts it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all have a side that we try to  hide...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myers stretches and places his hand and arm behind her ba Something hits him in the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets up, annoyed. No one in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy snickers, hiding and chewing a cookie. The Kid "g him five". INT. BROOMВґS OFFICE - NIGHT Kroenen's two pieces of paper are joined together under a MICRO-SCANNER. Broom watches as computer enhancement fill out a couple of missing areas. Cyrillic letters are now legible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pensive) SEBASTIAN PLACKBA #16... Moscow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broom pulls out a few old photos. Finds one of Grigory in German uniform, and in a book, another of Grigory in an  Orthodox priest's black cassock. He pulls out his old wooden box, pulls out a dusty book f it. His fingers scan the text, finding Rasputin's date of birth, date of death. They pause at a particular line: "H mausoleum is at SEBASTIAN PLACKBA #16".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Rasputin's mausoleum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TCHK!! A noise -- Broom turns in time to see Kroenen  delicately descending a spiral staircase, blade in hand. spite of all his experience, Broom is shaken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see the puppet. But -- where is...  the puppet master?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the dark, a voice hisses --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good, Professor Broom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broom turns. Grigory steps from the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was you: The scraps of paper,  Liz's sudden relapse and return...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) Bread crumbs on the trail. Like in a  fable. They both distract him and  guide him exactly where I need him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moscow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His destiny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He touches Broom's forehead, lightly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You raised the child. Nurtured him.  So, In return... Would you permit  me? A brief, brief glimpse? Of the  future --

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: A nightmarish tableau...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ruins of New York, charred, smoldering. Human remains litter the landscape. Monstrous shapes lumber in the  distance... an army of apocalyptic beasts outlined agains the blood-red sky. Dominating the horror is a mountain of festering skeleton and skulls. At the top, a figure: HELLBOY, transformed. H horns are in full bloom, his eyes and mouth stream uneart fire. INT. BROOMВґS OFFICE - NIGHT Startled, Broom snaps out of it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If only you had him destroyed sixty  years ago, none of this would come  to pass. But, then, how could you  have known?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broom is speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your God chooses to remain silent.  Mine lives within me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rasputin stands, the flesh of his neck and shoulders heav and twitching beneath his human skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the frozen waters of the Malaya  Nevka, in the darkness of the void:  every time I died and crossed over,  a little more of the Master came  back with me. He disclosed to me the  child's true name... Would you like  to know it??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what to call him. Nothing you  can say or do will change that. I  call him son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Discreetly, Broom removes his rosary and places it on the book. Kroenen settles in behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Now, I'll add two crumbs more: (Kroenen displays his  knives) Grief and revenge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kroenen's knife goes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pigeons flutter on the rooftop. The pigeon kid sits by Hellboy's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just go down there and tell her how  you feel! (Hellboy shakes his  head: no) My mom says --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that easy, okay? (beat) Plus, you're nine. You're not old  enough to give me advice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Who are those guys??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy turns and sees -- TWO of the black B.P.R.D. Sedan cars rounds the corner. Agent Lime bounds out of one of the vehicles, grabbing My talking rapidly. Liz screams, covers her ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's wrong --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agents and Bureau employees are crammed into Broom's offi doorway. Hellboy, face contorted by grief, pushes through

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is full of forensics people taking pictures, pic up evidence, etc. Tom Manning is there. Seeing Hellboy, h respectfully steps back. Broom's fragile body lies slumped in his chair. At his fe a pool of blood. Liz enters, then stifles a whimper. With tears in his eyes, a disbelieving Hellboy looks at L then at his dead father. He holds Broom's body close to h chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father -- I'm back. I'm back. I'm  back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manning herds everybody out. From the door, Liz blinks ba tears as the red giant kneels by the body: a dog with a l master.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't here. You died alone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's raining like hell. The PALLBEARERS, Manning and Myers among them, load Broom casket into a HEARSE. Flanking it are two rows of BPRD ag The hearse doors close and the vehicle pulls away. Watching like a gargoyle from a distant roof: Hellboy. Ra bounces off his wet overcoat. Liz observes him, worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hasn't spoken to anyone in three  days. Not a word. He doesn't eat, he  doesn't sleep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abe, conscious now, but still in the cast, floats upside  down, solving a RUBIK'S CUBE. Liz stands by the tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never seen him like this. Never. (beat) Should I stay? With him, I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles faintly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen -- I'm not much of a problem  solver... (displays the cube) Three decades and I've only gotten  two sides. (beat) But I know this much: if there's  trouble -- all we have is each other.  And I'm stuck here. (beat) So -- Take care of the big monkey  for me, will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their hands almost touch, separated only by the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PROJECTION SCREEN shows the enhanced image of the piece paper with Cyrillic characters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've collected and destroyed  thousands of eggs. No trace of this  "Sammael" or this "Rasputin"  character. But we have this address --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a meeting room, Manning stands at a polished obsidian  desk. A group of agents -- Myers among them -- listens  attentively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian Plackba #16. Volokolamsk  fields, fifty miles from Moscow. We  leave as soon as we get clearance  and equipment --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy's coming -- (beat) But I'll be in charge this time.  Either we wrap this up or I'm closing  this freak show for good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myers spots Liz walking past the conference room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy stands before Broom's desk, pensive, his naked ch bandaged. Liz watches him from across the room. He finds Broom's ro on top of the book. Reads the underlined phrase on the pa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to her. She slowly comes towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've changed my mind. I'll come to  Moscow. If you -- are still going --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy nods, then clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am. (beat) But -- I have something to say, too. (beat) I never had the guts before -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks her in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I understand what you don't like  about me. I do. What I am makes you  feel out of place -- out there --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red, I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen. I'm not like Myers. He makes  you feel like you belong. And --  that's good. It really is. I -- wish  I could do something about this -- (points at his own  face) But I can't. (beat) I can promise you only two things...  One: I'll always look this good.  Two: I won't give up on you. Ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Super: TOPOCKBA STEEL MILLS, MOSCOW A wasteland of rust a decay. Rotting warehouses line the street like dead steel watchdogs. No one's around but a few lonely sentries. A limo and motorcycle caravan are waved through the secur gates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A metal door trundles back and the limo and escort motorc enter. Fleshy Russian General -- LAPIKOV -- gets out of the limo Then Ilsa and Grigory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have accumulated many objects of  great interest. Preserving our  heritage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The warehouse contains a world of bric-a-brac: a towering marble LENIN HEAD, Old Master paintings, tanks, warheads, missiles, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many -- like me -- believe Mother  Russia to be very close to a historic  rebirth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop before a cargo container. With a butane torch, soldier melts away the lead Kremlin seal, then open the d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebirth? I like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A massive stone monolith of polished MARBLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty tons of stone. This thing  fell from the sky into Tungaska  forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June 30th, 1908. It burned hundreds  of square miles of forest. The  Romanovs took possession of it  immediately. The Czar guarded it  jealously -- I have wanted it for  ages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grigory's fingers brush over its smooth, perfect surface. the center -- -- TWO CIRCULAR IMPRINTS that match Hellboy's four-finger stone hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, finally, it's mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are aware, of course, there's no  way you'll get it out of Russian  territory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (curtly) He is aware.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ilsa brings out a chrome box, full of gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a pleasure doing business with  you. Perhaps you have other interests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grigory's voice drips with serene brutality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjoy the bright metal you've earned.  There will be no further transactions. (beat) Only closure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A massive CARGO PLANE slices the white eye of a full moon map details the plane's journey over the Black Sea. Super: RUSSIAN AIRSPACE - BLACK SEA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the plane engines DRONE, Myers supervises BPRD agents  Lime and Stone, who stencil a large crate: FRAGILE! LIVE  CARGO. Hellboy and Liz stand around a brightly-lit work table. Hellboy shows them the medieval illustration of Sammael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "One falls, two shall arise." So:  you pop one, two come out. You kill  two, you get four. You kill four,  you're in trouble. We have to nail  'em all at once. And the eggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we do: No mumbo-jumbo. Double- core Vulcan-65 grenades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MANNING shows them a set of GRENADE BELTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've installed a very handy timer.  Set it, walk away. Cable pulls the  safety pins, K-boom! Easy to clean,  easy to use...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupts) Those things never work. Never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each of us gets a belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs it off) I won't take 'em. They never work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manning looks at Hellboy, irate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll carry his --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy wraps Broom's rosary on his wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy Scout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two gleaming black vans and a truck move through snow-cov Soviet roads. Super:  VOLOKOLAMSK FIELDS, MOSCOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myers and LIZ struggle with a Moscow map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into a radio) Sparky to Big Red...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Popping her head out of the window, Liz looks back at the truck bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fastened to it, the crate labelled: LIVE CARGO. Small  breathing holes have been drilled in the sides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparky?? Who came up with that? Myers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz snickers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're almost there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy, sitting on the floor, in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) We're leaving the main road, so hang  on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hit a series of bumps. The box rattles and shakes.  Hellboy bangs his head. The vehicle lurches to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the radio) This better be the place or I'll  puke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motors are turned off. The crate is opened. Liz peeks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come out and see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy steps out. Takes a moment to adjust his eyes to t light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian Plackba #16...

dialogues.speaker: 19TH CENTURY CEMETERY, (MATTE SHOT / COMPOSITE)
dialogues.text: Broken spiked fences succumb to rust and dead vines. Endl rows of crypts and tombstones poke through wild foliage. Our group plus TWO AGENTS (Lime and Stone) venture into t labyrinthine lanes of the dead. Each carries a backpack, flashlight and a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later. The group gathers in frustration in an area of bar funerary monuments. Myers -- carrying the explosive belts looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. This is practically a  city. And it stinks, and it's muddy.  We'll go back, check into a hotel,  regroup after breakfast. We'll have  to make a grid, go by quadrants.  Maybe satellite photography.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gestures and all the agents head for the vans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me ask for directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group surrounds a grave. Hellboy raises the broken st cover and then jumps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and lands on a rotten coffin. In it, a mummified corps lies in a miserable black suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) Animam edere, animus corpus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He presses the amulet on the cadaver's forehead. For a mo nothing, and then... ...a brutal spasm!! The corpse gasps, breathes... and mut something in tongueless Russian. SUBTITLE: WHAT DO YOU WA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group gawks as Hellboy climbs out, carrying the CORPS on his back. With an ear-to-ear grin, he approaches the t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixty feet further, comrades, and  three rows in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The corpse fidgets on Hellboy's back. Its bony hand weakl points, as if in confirmation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This here is Ivan Klimentovich: Say  "hi" Ivan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The corpse mutters again. SUBTITLED: GO THAT WAY, RED MON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A miniature black marble castle. Using a crowbar, Myers p open the ancient steel door. Hellboy, still carrying the  desiccated abomination on his back, walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two agents stand guard in the mausoleum, while the group  descends carefully. The walls are dotted with yellowed sk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myers' flashlight flickers. He shakes it back to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach the bottom of the staircase: three corridors b off in different directions. Hellboy deposits the CORPSE  attop a pile of coffins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be alright... as long as we  don't separate --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TCHKANGGG!!!!! large spiked metal plates shoot up from be blocking both their way out, demolishing the staircase an ramming Stone: he's gone. Wicked spikes cover the metal surface. Hellboy still bang on it, but to no avail: it's at least six inches thick. L and Myers are on the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his walkie-talkie) Okay, someone's expecting us. Turn  on your locators -- Anyone sees  anything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Polo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the other side of the panel, Myers takes the radio fro Liz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) Are you sure about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a scale of one to ten: two. But -- (beat) -- she'll take care of you, Myers.  She's a tough one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz and Myers move off. Hellboy shines his light down the tunnel on the left. Agent Lime picks up the corpse and  follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy and Manning come into a vast chamber: Slavic moti crown the rugged stone pillars and archways. Water runs d the walls. Across a small stone bridge, light pours from a hexagonal structure. They step onto the bridge. KLANGGG!!! two gears release a steel door from above, forcing them to forge ahead. Somewhere, a  massive clockwork is TICKING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy motions for silence. The CORPSE mutters: "IT'S

dialogues.speaker: SOMETHING BIG"
dialogues.text: They stare into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should go back -- you -- you could  tear that door apart --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move. We --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- should go back. Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Don't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in charge. We go back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy yanks Manning just in time. BAMMM!!!! A gigantic  metal pendulum swings past and demolishes one third of th bridge a few feet from their feet. It takes Lime and the  CORPSE with it. Another door on the far end of the bridge shudders downwa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoosh! The PENDULUM swings back. It destroys more of the bridge. Manning sprints for all he's worth and crawls und the door. Hellboy runs, but chunks of stone disintegrate under his  feet. The pendulum swings back taking out the final piece of th bridge just as Hellboy rolls under the door -- -- and makes it into the hexagonal building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy and Manning find themselves in a very narrow, arc stone corridor. Its walls are lined with endless rows of  rusty steel blades. Faint traces of WAGNER can be heard. They cautiously  proceed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. In yellow gaslight, Kroenen nods attentively as a  phonograph plays the love duet from TRISTAN UND ISOLDE. Above him, ropes, hooks and pulleys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manning rest his hand too close to a blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kroenen comes alert. He scans the room, quietly winds him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy shoots a dirty look at Manning and then looks bac into the chamber -- -- Kroenen is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Manning) Crap. This guy moves like a cockroach --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy readies his gun and then creeps toward the lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy's footsteps elicit soft creaks from the wooden fl Manning moves along behind him. The record finishes playing. Silence -- SWISH!!! Kroenen's whirling blades slice the air, ripping into Manning's arm. As Kroenen goes in for the kill --  -- Hellboy thrusts out his stone fist as a shield. Kroene bears down but Hellboy fends him off with powerful, delib blocks. Kroenen hauls out one of his long swords.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy yanks it away and bends it like a twig. BAMMMM!!! He punches Kroenen in the face, crumpling the steel mask, smashing its lenses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed my father --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAMMM!!!! another hit. Kroenen staggers back with each blow. Finally, the mask f off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give your soul to God, Your ass is  mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An asthmatic wheeze erupts from his scarred face. Kroenen laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM!!! Under his feet, a huge trapdoor falls open. He and Manning drop through, along with the phonograph. Hellboy grabs a rope. It spins through a copper pulley, b a large knot jerks him to a stop. Hellboy snatches Mannin hand, but loses his backpack. He looks down. The phonograph hits the ground with a cras

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panting, whispers) Well, it's not that big a fall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KLANGGGG!!!!! The entire bottom bristles with six-foot,  sparkling steel blades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kroenen cautiously leans over the pit. He can't hear a so As he peeks -- SWISH!! A loop of the rope wraps around hi neck and yanks him forward! Before he goes over, he  frantically digs his blades into the floor, anchoring him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy has used the rope hanging below him as a lasso.  MANNING clings to his powerful back as he climbs up, hand over hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kroenen goes to cut the rope...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reaching the top) Oh, no you don't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy wraps the rope around his stone fist and, with a  brutal stone-fist yank, pulls KROENEN into the pit! With a horrible scream, Kroenen drops headfirst past them and onto the spikes. He wriggles like a fish caught on a  hook, only making it worse, as he slides further down the blades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy climbs out and sits. Sees Kroenen's blade embedde in the floor. Holding it: the prosthetic hand, still tick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy peers down. Still alive, Kroenen frees one arm,  slicing through his own ropy bicep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like playing possum, you Nazi  pinhead? (beat) Then try playing dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy tips a massive cogwheel over the edge. Kroenen em a horrid scream as it crushes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manning sits down, bandaging his injuries. Hellboy kneels down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manning nods weakly. Hellboy brings out a cigar and fires his Zippo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd better stay here. I'll find a  way out. We'll come back for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You call that thing a cigar??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never, ever light a cigar that  way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He digs out one of his fine cigars, cuts it and hands it HELLBOY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Use a wooden match. It preserves the  flavor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lights it for him. Hellboy grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) My job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A narrow tunnel. Liz and Myers advance carefully. Just ahead, a cave-in. Pieces of ceiling, timber, coffins and corpses form a chaotic barrier. As they squeeze past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, he thinks that you and I... That's  why he's mad at me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few bones roll by. Wet earth drops onto their shoulders They draw their arms close to their bodies, pointing thei flashlight beams straight down. A moment of strange intim

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's not true, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you feel that way about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to know -- Now -- ? Here?  Red, white, whatever -- Guys are all  the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy labors up a steep slope, using rocks and roots fo handholds. He reaches a dead end and collapses, out of br Light filters through a crack in the ground; he can faint hear Liz and Myers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz and Myers reach a wider section of Tunnel "B". They f themselves calf-deep in brown water. Myers lights Liz's path as she steps onto a large stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch out. It's slippery...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His light shorts out. She shines her light past him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myers turns. His flashlight comes back on, revealing a co natural cavern. An entire WALL IS COVERED with translucen eggs. SAMMAEL is there, gnawing on a dry arm bone, with the han still attached. When the light hits his face, his milky p constrict. A snarl... A SECOND SAMMAEL emerges from the water. It shakes itself off. A THIRD ONE raise its head. Myers and Liz try to back away, but a metal wall rises ri behind them KLANKKKKK!!! They are trapped!! Myers goes to grab a set of explosive belts. Tries to set the timer. Zipp! -- one Sammael snatches them away. Myers falls to the ground, clothes torn, injured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the radio) Marco, Marco, Marco... Get your Big  Red butt over here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something stomps on the ceiling directly above them. Agai and again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy pounds the floor with his rock hand. Furiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on kid, I'm coming for you!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rocks below him start to crumble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In an "ANT FARM" view of the complex, we see Hellboy abov pummeling and -- in the cavern below -- Liz and Myers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dust and rocks fall from above. The four identical creatu move in on Liz and Myers. Myers shoots one in the head th times. The creature shakes off the hits as if pelted with pebbles. One of them springs. As it flies through the air, Hellboy crashes through the ceiling. He lands on top of it along  with a ton or two of stone. The creature is crushed. Two eggs glow, metamorphosing. Presto -- two new Sammaels are born. The first two Sammaels growl, joined by the two new ones. Liz sprints to safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Just couldn't leave you two  alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy scoops up Myers and deposits him next to Liz. Lit by Myers' flashlight, two of the creatures jump. One  clamps onto Hellboy's back, the other onto his leg. Hellb howls. The third one joins in, like lions dragging down a zebra. This time, though, the zebra fights back. Hellboy pulls out his gun and fires a round into the ches of a Sammael. Two eggs glow -- two new Sammaels are born. They're FIVE. Hellboy's torso is covered in blood. He falls to the grou A fourth and a fifth creature spring onto him, biting. He is in trouble. Liz watches and shivers. A ripple of heat shimmers over h body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at Myers) Hit me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz is desperate, crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit me -- (beat) All of my life I've run away from  it... Now I want it to happen! Do  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy screams. Water explodes under the fighting bodies Two of the Sammaels turn their attention to Liz and Myers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't, I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz slaps him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know now: I love him. I've always  loved him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat of silence, then Myers slaps her across the face,  once. Hard. The heat ripple builds. The air vibrates arou her. Her pupils kick back light, like an animal's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myers ducks behind a rock as Liz's arms blaze with fire. The two approaching Sammaels are ready to pounce. On top of Hellboy, one of them turns its head, like a lio hearing the hunter's gunshots. A staggering Hellboy sees  Liz's body shake in a surge of white-hot energy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weak) Liz...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water at her feet blows away as a concave shockwave o fire expands. The fire engulfs the creatures. Devours them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screen FADES TO WHITE and then... Silence, then a pulse. A high ringing tone. A heartbeat. Hellboy pushes away the half-cooked remains of two Sammae The other creatures are little more than blackened bones. stumbles forward. No water left. Everything is half-burie in a cracked, bone-dry bed of mud. Liz lies on the ground on her side, unconscious. Myers is alive, but too groggy to even acknowledge it. We Hellboy turns around: In the eerie silence of his deafnes he sees Grigory -- LAUGHING noiselessly, witness to an ab comedy. Ilsa approaches. And -- in a simple, brutal move -- hits with a hammer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy slowly comes to. He is chained to a massive woode yoke. He takes notice of his surroundings: a large church like space, surrounded by funeral niches and statues hold swords. High columns flank huge mechanical gears. An SOLA SYSTEM MODEL takes the place of an altar. Off to one side, Ilsa uses a hammer to destroy the timers the explosive belts. Next to the main nave, Myers is tied to a stone pillar. U his feet, a blood channel, leading to the immense stone s bought from Lapikov. Liz lies at Grigory's feet. He's dressed in a ceremonial  robe and holds his leather book open. His back to Hellboy he faces a mural of the angel Abbadon holding a key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "And I looked and beheld an Angel,  and in his hand the key to the  bottomless pit..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy tenses, rage building. The yoke creaks, but doesn bend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gestures at the stone  piece) These were the words I heard as a  peasant boy in Tobolsk. And now, the  door -- Sent by the Ogdruh Jahad so  that they might at long last enter  our world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hellboy) You are the key! The right hand of  doom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy studies the stone sculpture, its three HAND IMPRI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (triumphant) What did you think it was made for?  Open the locks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy stares at his huge right arm, as if for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do it!! Don't do it!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ilsa kicks Myers in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The open dome above reveals the moon. An eclipse is begin The altar's clockworks monitors its progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imagine it: An eden for you and her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grigory turns to Hellboy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? (reasonable) In exchange for her life then, open  the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In torment, Hellboy, shakes his head: no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you wish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans over Liz, whispers in her ear: Her body arches, mouth emits a plume of energy. Grigory greedily inhales i Then she goes limp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noooo! Noooo!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He struggles again. One of the cuffs snaps. He swats Ilsa with his free hand. She stumbles backwards. Now Hellboy f to free his other hand. Indifferent, Grigory watches the  eclipse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her soul awaits on the other side.  If you want her back... (beat) Open the door and claim her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His head and heart racing, Hellboy struggles for an answe Can't find one... the moon is almost totally eclipsed. He drops his gaze. His voice a hoarse whisper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grigory moves close to Hellboy. Rips the rosary off his w It lands near Myers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Names hold the power and nature of  things. Mine for example. Rasputin:  "The crossroads." (beat) And crossroads I have become. (beat) Your true name: Anung-un-Rama. Repeat  it. Become the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (closing his eyes) Anung-un-Rama...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy's stone arm glows. Ancient symbols of fire burn t stone. Flames momentarily engulf his body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy roars as his HORNS majestically burst forth! Out his mouth, energy and light boil like condensing breath o winter's night. Inebriated with power, the new PRINCE OF HELL smiles with supreme arrogance. His shadow falls on the white marble o the slab and mysteriously spreads over it until the stone turns black as obsidian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!! Don't do it!! Listen to me!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HELLBOY inserts his enormous paw into the FIRST IMPRINT o the stone slab -- CLACK!! He turns it, like a lock. A beam of crimson light shoot upwards into the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visible from all over Moscow, the beam blazes to the moon The same phenomenon as in the prologue, but this time it' more intense, with ripples and haloes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, the infinite, starry space. Again, the OGDRU JAHAD The ruby beam pierces the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy watches as the FIRST IMPRINT disappears. In its p a burning glyph. Myers struggles with his bindings. The rough hemp cuts hi skin, but he manages to free one hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OGDRU JAHAD shifts, suddenly breaking free. Gelatinous li uncurl, expand. Its enormity puzzles the eye, obscuring t frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy thrusts his hand into the SECOND IMPRINT. CLACK! turns it. Myers spots the broken rosary and reaches for it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grigory drinks in the first signs of the arrival and laug

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The final seal. Open it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy puts his hand inside, CLACK!!! Before he can turn it, Myers reaches the rosary. Ilsa lunges at him. He clob her full in the face. She staggers back and down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hellboy) Remember who you are!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws the rosary at Hellboy. Instinctively, Hellboy  catches it. It smokes in his hand. He tosses it away. It lands next to the explosive belts. Hellboy opens his palm, seeing the smoking, charred impri of the cross and beads. He looks over at Grigory.
